Articles.Content:
I have a few questions:

  1. What do I add in Unity to give it a useable hatch?
  2. What do I add in Unity to give it a useable ladder?
  3. When making the inside how do I get the seats to be the right size and shape? Can I just add them in from Unity like the control panel stuff?

This thread has the answers you need : http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/94638-New-Mod-Development-Links-Compilation

In particular, the video tutorials by nli2work are exactly what you want- step by steps on the whole cockpit process, including ladders and airlocks(hatches). There's also a text tutorial further down, under ladders. The short version is - you add box colliders in Unity that define the space a kerbal will be occupying when he's able to grab the hatch and the ladder, with the z axis pointing up, the way he'd climb. You set these colliders as triggers, and put them in the correct layers.

Yes, making your seats as props and adding them in Unity at the same time as the control panel props is a great way to do it, because they remain moveable and resizeable during testing, whereas if you modelled them into the pod's interior model initially, you have to go all the way back to your 3d modelling step to move them if you see the kerbal's head clipping through something! I don't think the stock game comes with a seat prop, so you'll either have to model it yourself, then make it a prop (again, nli2work's tutorials show you how to make your own prop!) or use one already done (The ASET props pack has a great flight seat in it, along with other awesome cockpit gizmos!)
